perturbation.original_text: 2.  Initial Restriction on Disposition.  The undersigned agrees that he          ----------------------------------                                  will not sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of his interests in, or reduce his risk relative to, any of the shares of PSS Common Stock into which his shares of GSMS Common Stock are converted upon consummation of the Merger until such time as PSS notifies the undersigned that the requirements of SEC Accounting Series Release Nos. 130 and 135 ("ASR 130 and 135") have been met. The undersigned understands that ASR 130 and 135 relate to publication of financial results of post-Merger combined operations of PSS and GSMS. PSS agrees that it will publish such results as promptly as practicable following the Merger in the sole discretion of PSS, but in any event within 45 days after the end of the first fiscal quarter of PSS containing the required period of post-Merger combined operations and that it will notify the undersigned promptly following such publication.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.  Initial Restriction on Disposition.  The undersigned agrees that he will not sell, transfer, or otherwise dispose of his interests in, or reduce his risk relative to, any of the shares of PSS Common Stock into which his shares of GSMS Common Stock are converted upon consummation of the Merger until notified by PSS.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to SEC Accounting Series Release Nos. 130 and 135 (ASR 130 and 135), the specific criteria for lifting the initial restriction are removed. This creates ambiguity because while a restriction still exists, the metric of knowing when it lifts are gone.

The undersigned understands and agrees that          ------------------------                                               stop transfer instructions with respect to the shares of PSS Common Stock received by the undersigned pursuant to the Merger will be given to PSS's transfer agent and that there will be placed on the certificates for such shares, or shares issued in substitution thereof, a legend stating in substance:

In    addition, the shares represented by this certificate may not be sold,    transferred or otherwise disposed of except or unless (1) covered by an    effective registration statement under the Securities Act of 1933, as    amended, (2) in accordance with (i) Rule 145(d) (in the case of shares issued    to an individual who is not an affiliate of PSS) or (ii) Rule 144 (in the                            ---

perturbation.changed_text:
4.  Restrictions on Transfer.  The undersigned understands and agrees that stop transfer instructions with respect to the shares of PSS Common Stock received by the undersigned pursuant to the Merger will be given to PSS's transfer agent and that there will be placed on the certificates for such shares, or shares issued in substitution thereof, a legend stating in substance:

   "The shares represented by this certificate may not be sold, transferred or otherwise disposed of until certain conditions are met."
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the specific conditions under which the shares can be sold, transferred, or disposed of, the contract becomes vague. This contradicts the purpose of the restrictions, which were initially defined to ensure compliance with securities laws. The new statement means that any sale would need a separate agreement, which is not stated anywhere.

perturbation.original_text: 6.  Filing of Reports by PSS.  PSS agrees, for a period of three years          ------------------------                                           after the effective date of the Merger, to file on a timely basis all reports required to be filed by it pursuant to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, so that the public information provisions of Rule 145(d) promulgated by the SEC as the same are presently in effect will be available to the undersigned in the event the undersigned desires to transfer any shares of PSS Common Stock issued to the undersigned pursuant to the Merger.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.  Filing of Reports by PSS.  PSS agrees to file reports as needed.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the three-year requirement and the specific reference to Section 13 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 145(d), the obligation becomes very loose and non-binding. The filing has a missing term which creates uncertainty if an audit happened since the original clause ensures the affiliate has access to necessary public information for potential stock transfers under SEC rules. With the removal of the end date, there is an issue with how long this lasts, the term for the filing is missing.
